org.hkijena.acaq5.api.parameters

Annotation Type ACAQParameter


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface ACAQParameter
    Annotates a getter or setter function as parameter. ACAQParameterAccess will look for this annotation to find parameters.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String value
      The unique key of this parameter

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      double priority
      Sets the priority for (de)serializing this parameter.
      String shortKey
      A short key used for generating parameter strings.
      int uiOrder
      Controls how the parameter is ordered within the user interface
      ACAQParameterVisibility visibility
      Sets if the parameter is visible to the user or only exported into JSON Lower visibilities override higher visibilities.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        The unique key of this parameter
        Returns:
        Parameter key

      • visibility

        public abstract ACAQParameterVisibility visibility
        Sets if the parameter is visible to the user or only exported into JSON Lower visibilities override higher visibilities. If used as visibility for a sub-parameter collection, this property determined a minimum visibility the sub-parameters must have to be shown in the UI.
        Returns:
        Parameter visibility
        Default:
        org.hkijena.acaq5.api.parameters.ACAQParameterVisibility.TransitiveVisible

      • priority

        public abstract double priority
        Sets the priority for (de)serializing this parameter. Please use the priority constants provided by Priority
        Returns:
        the priority
        Default:
        0.0

      • shortKey

        public abstract String shortKey
        A short key used for generating parameter strings. Defaults to value() in ACAQParameterAccess implementations if not provided
        Returns:
        A short key used for generating parameter strings
        Default:
        ""

      • uiOrder

        public abstract int uiOrder
        Controls how the parameter is ordered within the user interface
        Returns:
        a low number indicates that this parameter is put first, while a high number indicates that this parameter is put last
        Default:
        0
